title: Rengar0722
author: Rengar0722
content: Hi I am the operation specialist from one DeFi project, just wondering if we are going to post the bounty campaign here, is campaign manager necessary or we can post and operate everything by our own marketing team?

comments.author: TheUltraElite
comments.body: Quote from: Rengar0722 on November 02, 2022, 01:58:34 PMHi I am the operation specialist from one DeFi project, just wondering if we are going to post the bounty campaign here, is campaign manager necessary or we can post and operate everything by our own marketing team?  You can post on your own but hiring a bounty manager has its own advantages, like so:1. Most bounty managers are well reputed and known widely in this forum. Hiring one of them means hiring their repute and name too.2. Bounty managers have been organizing such campaigns every day for several projects. They have years of experience and the skills needed to do produce a successful campaign.3. The bounty participants usually keep the managers post pages bookmarked to keep track of what new projects they are publishing, so you can be sure that your project will immediately get the recognition is deserves.4. Participants feel safe working under a reputed manager compared to a newbie account posting about a project.Comparing to these advantages, the only disadvantage is that you need pay the manager and keep the bounty payment in escrow. But I think that is a good trade-off.Good luck on your project!

comments.author: Oilacris
comments.body: Quote from: Rengar0722 on November 02, 2022, 01:58:34 PMHi I am the operation specialist from one DeFi project, just wondering if we are going to post the bounty campaign here, is campaign manager necessary or we can post and operate everything by our own marketing team? It depends whether you would be hiring a manager or you are the ones who would really be running such bounty program but in my opinion, if you dont have that much knowledge or awareness on howthis forum works or being familiar on boards and threads or even with the rules and how things works around then it would be ideal and preferable on hiring reputablebounty managers of this forum.Although, dont make yourself that expect about success rate is high when hiring managers but i could assure you that majority of them would really be ableto handle out the bounty campaign professionally.

You can operate on your own if you think that you can handle it well. But, it's always giving the benefit for the project if you're going to hire a known campaign manager. Why? Because they've got a solid background on how to run these campaigns well and stuck to their names their reputation will definitely be used for your project because your project is being run by them. However, the assessment of being a good project will depend on them, as a good campaign and reputable manager will study your proposal and the project itself before they accept to run your campaign.

comments.body: It's fine if you want to manage the campaign yourself, but make sure you're pay the participants with Bitcoin or top 10 cryptocurrency and escrow the bounty rewards to trusted user. comments.author: poodle63
comments.body: Quote from: Rengar0722 on November 10, 2022, 08:12:14 AMOK THX guys, but one more question I would like to ask:What is the stake representing for? Is it like the rewards will be distributed proportionally by the total stakes in the pool?Stake will determine how much reward will be acquired by the participants. Yes it is, total reward being pooled will be divided with the total stakes that already collected by all of participants in section then final reward will be calculated based on that formula. Sometimes there are some campaigns that were also using fixed reward distribution based on per task that has been done by the participants but i would prefer stake as this is much more easier to calculate the final reward.

comments.author: TheUltraElite
comments.body: Quote from: Rengar0722 on November 10, 2022, 08:12:14 AMOK THX guys, but one more question I would like to ask:What is the stake representing for? Is it like the rewards will be distributed proportionally by the total stakes in the pool? One stake represents your share of the total bounty pool. So more stakes mean more rewards but be aware that the bounty pool might also be a large number and once the bounty ends, the total stakes you collected divided by the total stakes distributed in all is the fraction which you receive from the bounty pool. There are usually limitations as per your rank on how many stakes you can collect and the number of activities you could perform.Since you are preparing for a bounty, this is the better economic method compared to the fixed rewards method.
